Package renderer.scene

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderer.scene.Position
  • public final class Position
extends Object
    A Position data structure represents a geometric object in a distinct location in three-dimensional view space as part of a Scene.

    A Position object holds references to a Model object and a Vector object. The Model represents the geometric object in the Scene. The Vector determines the model's location in the Camera's view coordinate system.

    When the renderer renders this Position's Model into a FrameBuffer, the first stage of the rendering pipeline, Model2View, adds this Position's translation Vector to every Vertex in the Model's vertex list, which converts the coordinates in each Vertex from the model's own local coordinate system to the Camera's view coordinate system (which is "shared" by all the other models in the scene). This vector addition has the effect of "placing" the model in view space at an appropriate location.
